reasoning: BBS15 is an extremely rare subtype of Bardet-Biedl syndrome caused by mutations in WDPCP gene (C2ORF86). While general BBS prevalence is 1 in 140,000-160,000 (6-7 per 100k), BBS15 represents only isolated documented families, making it significantly rarer. Using conservative estimate of ~0.5 per 100k for this specific subtype. Low confidence due to extreme rarity and limited epidemiological data for this specific subtype.
source: GeneReviews - Bardet-Biedl Syndrome overview; multiple molecular studies identifying isolated BBS15 families
